It appears that the problem is more common than I originally suspected. Here is a better repro:

1. File -> New -> Project...
2. Web -> Dynamic Web Project
3. Type "WebProject " (with a space at the end) in the project name field
** NOTE: THERE ARE NO VALIDATION ERRORS ON THE WIZARD **
4. Click Finish

See the exception reported previously. 

I think the correct behavior here should be to trim the trailing space rather than flagging it as an error in the wizard. Based on this new information, I feel that there is a high probability that our users will run into this. I will request that this be added to 1.0.1 Hot List.
Added to the 1.0.1 Hot List at the request of Konstantin Komissarchik. Set to P2.

I went ahead and added the validation for the white space at the end of the project name.  That is a much simpler solution than trying to trim the white space and keep all ui's and nested models in synch.  It also gives the user immediate feedback as opposed to some trickery behind the scenes.  

This is released for the 01/18/06 evening WTP 1.0.1 driver.

It is a minor thing, but the error says "A project already exists at that name and location." That's fine but the directoy field is not updated when an error message is shown.

For example, create a web project "WebProject" then open the wizard and type "WebProject" into the name field and the error message is shown describing a location that is "WebProjec" (without the 't') -- no project exists there so the message looks wrong.
Since you can't have  projects with same names in the workspace, regardless of the location,  i modified the error message to show that "A project already exists with this name"
